translation.en: [young man] I didn't really have your typical upbringing.
I mean, I did at first, but then the world ended.
translation.ko: 뭐, 초반에는 평범했는데 세상의 종말이 왔거든요

translation.en: I don't think anyone was really shocked.
We always thought it might, and then it just finally happened.
translation.ko: 늘 생각해 오던 일이 마침내 현실이 됐을 뿐이죠 "NETFLIX 제공"

translation.en: But how it happened, now that's where it gets interesting.
translation.ko: 세상의 종말이 어떻게 왔느냐 이게 아주 흥미로운 얘기예요

translation.en: Agatha 616.
Yep, an asteroid heading straight for Earth.
translation.ko: 그래요, 이 소행성이 지구를 향해 곧장 날아왔죠

translation.en: I know. So obvious.
So, humanity came together, and we did what we do best.
translation.ko: 이에 인류는 힘을 모아 가장 자신 있는 방법으로 맞섰죠

translation.en: We shot a bunch of rockets at it! And we blew it up! And it was great!
translation.ko: 소행성을 향해 로켓을 쏴대서 시원하게 터뜨려 버렸어요!

translation.en: But it wasn't. You see, the thing that makes rockets rockets--
translation.ko: 전혀 기뻐할 일이 아니었죠 로켓이 로켓일 수 있는 건

translation.en: chemical compounds, a lot of 'em.
Which rained back down on us, and everything changed.
translation.ko: 화학 물질들이 비처럼 쏟아지며 모든 것이 달라졌어요

translation.en: And by "everything," I mean cold-blooded creatures.
And by "changed," I mean mutated and started eating us to death.
translation.ko: '달라졌다'는 건 돌연변이가 돼서 인간을 잡아먹기 시작했단 거고요

translation.en: Ants, lizards, roaches, crocodiles. You name it. There's a lot of 'em.
translation.ko: 개미, 도마뱀, 바퀴벌레, 악어 다 얘기하자면 끝도 없죠

translation.en: I knew this one kid who was eaten in his sleep by a goldfish he won at a carnival.
translation.ko: 제가 알던 토드라는 애는 자다가 축제에서 얻은 금붕어한테 먹혔죠

translation.en: -[growls] -Man, Todd loved that goldfish.
And that cat.
So, for most of human history, if you wanted to kill a cockroach,
translation.ko: 인류 역사상 대부분의 경우 바퀴벌레를 죽이려면

translation.en: all you needed was a shoe.
Well, suddenly you needed a shotgun.
And sometimes even a tank.
And sometimes even that doesn't work.
Especially if you don't stay in the tank, Bob.
translation.ko: 특히 탱크 밖으로 나왔다면 당할 수밖에 없죠, 밥처럼요

translation.en: Eventually, the really big ones and our military took each other out.
translation.ko: 결국에는 거대한 괴물들과 군대가 서로를 죽여나갔죠

translation.en: We lost 95% of the human population in about a year.
That's a lot of Bobs.
And a lot of Todds.
Those of us who survived, we hid anywhere we could--
translation.ko: 살아남은 사람들은 몸을 숨길 수 있는 곳으로 갔죠

translation.en: bunkers, caves, panic rooms, all around the world.
translation.ko: 벙커, 동굴, 패닉 룸을 찾아내 세계 곳곳에서 숨어 살았어요

translation.en: So for the last seven years I've been living in an underground bunker.
translation.ko: 그래서 전 지난 7년 동안 지하 벙커에서 살았죠

translation.en: It's not-- It's not as bad as it sounds. Really.
It's a great group of people, and we all love each other.
It's kinda what I imagined college would have been like.
-[panting] -[woman] Are you sure he's asleep?
[man] Who?
-[woman] Joel. Who else? -[man] Yeah. He's asleep.
-[woman] Hang on. Shh. -[man] He's not awake.
-[woman] Are you sure? -It's just you.
[woman] I just-- I don't…
[man] Joel. Joel.
[whispering] See? He's not awake.
-It's just you. -[woman sighs]
[Joel] Dear Aimee, I am wide awake.
I've just gotten good at not really moving or breathing.
translation.ko: 꼼짝 않고 숨을 참는 데에 도가 텄을 뿐이지

translation.en: Being stuck in a survival bunker
with a bunch of people who have all found their soul mate is less than ideal.
translation.ko: 영혼의 짝을 이룬 이들과 살아가는 삶은 이상적이지는 않아

translation.en: Karen and Ray got together a few months ago,
translation.ko: 캐런과 레이는 몇 달 전에 커플이 됐어

translation.en: so they're still kinda in their honeymoon phase.
-[Karen, Ray continue moaning] -It is super physical.
Good for them, you know. They're both very attractive and apparently quite flexible.
translation.ko: 잘됐지, 둘 다 아주 매력적이고 유연한 몸을 가졌어

translation.en: Hey, life's short. Especially down here.
translation.ko: 뭐, 인생은 짧잖아 이 지하에서는 더욱 그렇지

translation.en: -Oh. Hey, Ava. -[Ava] Hey, Joel.
-[man] Joel. How's it going? -It's going good, Tim.
-How are you-- How are you doing? -[Tim] Yeah, good.
[Joel] Cool.
-I couldn't sleep. -[Ava] Yeah, we know the feeling.
translation.ko: - 잠이 안 드네 - 우리도 그 기분 알아

translation.en: Yeah. Probably not for the same reasons.
You guys's, uh, door's open. Is that-- Did you know that?
-[Ava] Yeah. -[Tim] Yeah, we know.
Okay.
[Joel] After Tim's parents were eaten by termites,
he and Ava became inseparable.
Okay. Good night.
-In every way. -[both] Night.
That's the asteroid they named 616 Agatha.
And these are all the chemical bombs they sent up to try and…
[Joel] So, pretty much everyone's coupled up down here.
translation.ko: 그러니까 여기에선 거의 모두가 짝을 이뤘어

translation.en: Our first baby was born last winter. It was super emotional.
translation.ko: 지난겨울에 첫 아이가 태어났는데 진짜 감동적인 순간이었어

translation.en: Welcome to the apocalypse, kid.
The food sucks. At least you'll never know what you're missing.
translation.ko: 음식이 형편없을 테지만 다른 세상을 모르는 게 다행이야

translation.en: Kala and Connor got together after Carol died.
translation.ko: 케일라와 코너는 캐럴이 죽은 후에 사귀었어

translation.en: Carol was a cow who ate a box of laundry detergent.
translation.ko: 캐럴은 소인데 세탁 세제를 통째로 먹고 죽었어

translation.en: -And now we only have one cow. -[cow mooing]
Her name's Gertie.
Gertie is great.
Gertie's not our only food source.
We have a hunting party that brings back whatever they can from the surface.
translation.ko: 수색 팀이 지상에 나가서 가져올 수 있는 건 모조리 가져와

translation.en: It was easier in the beginning, you know, before we ran out of bullets.
translation.ko: 처음에는 쉬웠는데 총알이 다 떨어지고 말았지

translation.en: Facing down one of those things with a janky handmade weapon
translation.ko: 손수 만든 어설픈 무기를 들고 괴물과 맞서는 건

translation.en: is no walk in the park.
Or so they tell me. I-I don't go on the hunting parties.
translation.ko: 그렇다고 들었어 나는 수색 팀에 끼지 않거든

translation.en: They need me in the kitchen. I'm kinda the… -[chopping] -…the chef of the bunker.
translation.ko: 나는 주방을 지켜야만 해 이 벙커의 셰프인 셈이지

translation.en: Everyone likes my minestrone.
Being the only single person in the bunker has its perks too.
translation.ko: 난 유일한 싱글로서 특권을 누리고 있어

translation.en: I get to hang out with Mavis.
Of course, she's not much for conversation anymore.
Her core battery's shot, just like every other Mavis, I'd imagine.
translation.ko: 얘도 다른 메이비스들처럼 코어 배터리가 망가졌나 봐

translation.en: Actually never seen a working one.
[Joel] Sure wish you were here, Aimee.
I'd love for you to meet everyone.
[Joel] Oh, yeah.
Maybe we could do a little target practice together.
translation.ko: 같이 사격 연습을 할 수도 있겠지

translation.en: It's kinda my thing.
Well…
-Sorry, Mavis. -[Gertie moos]
[Connor] Hustle, hustle, people. We gotta move.
[grunting] Guys!
Guys! I got the weapons.
-Stay. -What?
-Get what you need, and let's go. -What's happening? What's going on?
translation.ko: - 각자 무기 챙겨서 가자 - 왜 그래, 무슨 일인데?

translation.en: -[Connor] We're breached. -Breached?
-Joel. -What do you mean?
-Like inside-the-bunker breached? -That's what "breached" means, kiddo.
translation.ko: - 괴물이 벙커로 들어왔단 거야? - 정확히 그 뜻이지

translation.en: [whispers] Breached.
Anna Lucia and I will engage. Anderson and Tim, flank us.
translation.ko: 애나 루시아와 내가 교전할게 앤더슨하고 팀은 측면을 맡아

translation.en: Flank 'em, yeah, okay. Where do you guys need me? The rear, or--
-I thought we were past this, Joel. -Past what? You need help. I can help.
translation.ko: - 그 이야기는 끝냈잖아, 조엘 - 뭘 끝내? 나도 도울 수 있어

translation.en: -Let me help. -You gonna make me say it?
-Say what? -You can't handle it, Joel.
-You're shook. -Okay, yeah.
-So, you guys don't get scared ever? -[Connor] We get scared.
translation.ko: - 너희는 겁먹은 적 없어? - 우리도 겁먹지

translation.en: [Tim] We all get scared, Joel, but you get really scared.
-We're not trying to make you feel bad. -We love you, Joel.
translation.ko: - 기분 나쁘게 듣지는 마 - 우리는 너를 사랑해

translation.en: [Connor] But you're unsafe.
-[Tim] You're a liability. -Even on supply runs.
Okay, why did that speech feel so rehearsed?
translation.ko: 다들 어떻게 말할까 미리 연습이라도 했어?

translation.en: -Connor. -[device beeps]
Okay, 30 meters out. Let's move.
-Be careful, Connor-Bear. -I will, Kala-Bee.
[Connor] Load out.
Go with them.
[Karen] They're getting close.
-[gasps] -[Ava] Shit.
[Karen whispers] Oh, my God.
-[Anderson] It got one of 'em. -[Karen] What about the others?
They're coming back.
They need help. I'm going.
[Kala] Joel! Wait!
-[whispering] Connor? -[faint groan]
Connor.
Did I shoot it, or did you?
translation.ko: 내가 쏜 거야, 네가 쏜 거야?

translation.en: What do you think?
You.
[Joel] Oh, and I have a pretty severe freezing problem.
translation.ko: 아, 나는 중요한 순간에 몸이 얼어붙어서 문제야

translation.en: But I am working on it.
-[woman whispers] How is it looking? -I think it looks really good.
-Does it look like me? -Yeah.
Are you sure that this pose looks natural?
-Yeah. -Yeah?
I think it's really good.
What are you doing? Don't move.
-Will you let me see it? -Don't-- Don't move. Aimee.
-I really wanna see it. -[growls]
[laughs] Can I see it?
Okay.
Okay.
-Ready? -Mm-hmm.
[Joel] What do you think?
Why do I have a beard? [snickers]
No, that's shading. I did the shading.
My head is-- is so large.
-You have a big head. -And my hand is so tiny.
translation.ko: - 네 머리가 크긴 하지 - 손은 너무너무 작고

translation.en: You have tiny hands.
I love it. I frickin' love it.
-That's super sweet, 'cause it's terrible. -[Aimee laughs]
-I got you something too. -What?
I don't know if these are the right ones.
No way. These are the ones that I-I-I wanted to get.
-Really? -Yeah.
-What's happening right now? -Uh--
-Are you okay? -Yeah, I'm dancing with my shoulders.
-Oh, yeah. -Oh, yeah.
This has been the best summer of my life.
Mine too.
What are you doing?
-Do you know what time it is? -Uh, I think it's, like, 6:30.
Aimee, you're-- you're scaring Crocodile Carl.
Okay, look away, Crocodile Carl.
Oh. Look away. Hey, I get it.
-[Aimee giggles] -I get it.
We need to go.
I'm scared.
[Joel] Dear Aimee, This week has been especially shitty.
We lost Connor to what looked like a really big ant.
translation.ko: 거대한 개미 같은 놈한테 코너를 잃었어

translation.en: Helps me to draw them.
I try to capture their essence,
scribble down some notes on how to kill them.
Sometimes I think it's the only way I know how to cope with these things.
translation.ko: 내가 놈들한테 맞설 방법은 이것뿐이다 싶을 때도 있어

translation.en: -[switch clicks] -This is 7045. Come in, 3022.
-I repeat, come in, 3022. Over. -[switch clicks]
[woman] This is 3022. What is it now, Ray?
Hey, Janice. No, it's actually-- It's, uh, Joel.
-[chuckles] Oh. Joel. -Yeah.
All right. Hold on one second.
Aimee, it's Ray!
It's Joel. Thanks, Janice.
-[Aimee] Joel! Hey! -Hey, Aimee! Hi!
-How are you? -Hi. Yeah, I, uh-- I'm good.
-It's so good to hear your voice. -I'm so sorry.
I heard on the open frequency that one of you guys got killed.
translation.ko: 너희 쪽에서 한 명이 당했다고 공용 주파수로 들었어

translation.en: Yeah. Breached the bunker.
Wow. Actually got inside?
Yeah. It's the first time it's happened. It was kinda scary.
Did you have to fight it too?
Yeah. Yeah, a little. I had to fight it a little bit.
Actually got super ripped since the last time you saw me, so--
translation.ko: 우리 안 보는 사이에 나 완전 몸짱 됐거든

translation.en: Oh. Wow! [giggles] Super ripped, huh?
Yeah, I was kidding. I'm not super ripped. That was just a bad joke.
translation.ko: 농담이야, 뭔 몸짱이야 농담이 너무 구렸네

translation.en: Well, I'm glad you're okay.
Thanks. Yeah.
I am still kinda blown away that you were even able to find my colony on this thing.
translation.ko: 무전으로 우리 집단을 찾아내다니 아무리 생각해도 놀라운 일이야

translation.en: I know. It's pretty crazy.
'Cause I found it on the first one. What are the odds?
-[both chuckle] -[Aimee] Crazy.
Yeah. No, I-I called-- I called, like, 90.
Hey, you know what I, uh-- know what I wish sometimes?
What?
That I could, like, s-snap my fingers and be back in that car with you.
translation.ko: 손가락을 튕기면 너랑 차에 있던 그때로 돌아갈 수 있으면 좋겠어

translation.en: Man, that'd be nice.
Yeah. Too bad it's, uh…
you know, impossible.
Kinda feels like everything is impossible these days.
translation.ko: 요즘엔 모든 게 불가능한 것 같아

translation.en: Taking care of this whole colony is exhausting.
translation.ko: 이 큰 집단을 이끄느라 너무 지쳐

translation.en: I, uh-- I-I write you letters.
Really?
Yeah. Yeah, I-I write you letters sometimes.
-Aw! -All the time.
I'd love to read 'em.
-Really? I would love to read them to-- -[static surges, stops]
-No. Aimee? -[switches clicking]
-Aimee? -[static buzzing]
[Joel] We've lost a lot of people over the years.
You'd think you'd get numb to it after a certain point.
translation.ko: 어느 정도 겪고 나면 무뎌지지 않을까 싶겠지만

translation.en: You don't.
-I'm sorry. -Thank God! Where have you been, Joel?
We have to go right now. Say your goodbyes, get in the car.
translation.ko: 지금 당장 가야 하니까 작별 인사 하고 차에 타

translation.en: -I should go. -Maybe you should come with us.
-No, my mom is waiting. I'm sorry. -[creature roaring]
Get in the car! Aimee, you need to hurry home now!
translation.ko: 차에 타! 에이미, 너도 어서 집으로 가!

translation.en: -I want you to have this. -What? This is Crocodile Carl.
It's your good luck charm.
-Be careful. -You too.
Aimee.
I love you.
I love you too.
I'm gonna come find you.
You better.
[Aimee's voice] You better.
[Anna Lucia] I wanna know how it got in.
[Ray] It appears to have ripped through one of our perimeter defenses.
translation.ko: 전면 방어벽 하나를 찢은 것 같아

translation.en: [Ava] It ripped through steel?
[Tim] Anderson and I resealed the breach point and vent.
translation.ko: 찢어진 곳하고 환기구는 나랑 앤더슨이 다시 막았어

translation.en: -Nothing's getting in that way again. -But why did it happen?
translation.ko: - 그쪽으로 다신 못 들어와 - 왜 이런 일이 생긴 거지?

translation.en: It was a freak occurrence. There's no reason to think it'll happen again.
translation.ko: 어쩌다 한 번 뚫린 거니까 또 그럴 리는 없어

translation.en: -[Ray] We should try to stay calm. -[all arguing]
-How far away is Aimee's colony? -[arguing stops]
-What? -Aimee's colony.
-How far away is it? -About 85 miles.
-How long does that take to get there? -You're not actually thinking of going?
translation.ko: 며칠이나 걸릴까? 진짜 가려는 건 아니지?

translation.en: Tim, just… humor me.
-How long? -Seven days.
Minimum.
An armed and trained hunting party would be lucky to last 50 miles on the surface.
translation.ko: 훈련을 하고 무장한 수색 팀도 운이 좋아야 80km를 갈 텐데

translation.en: But you, Joel…
All right, now I need volunteers
to help reinforce some of the outer perimeter.
-[Anna Lucia] Yeah, I'm gonna go. -[all chattering]
-Ava's got this. -[Karen] Exactly.
I'm gonna go.
It's an impossible journey, Joel.
No, I'm serious.
I love you guys, but there's one person in this world
translation.ko: 너희를 사랑하지만 이 세상에서 유일하게 나를 행복하게 해줬던 사람이

translation.en: who ever truly made me happy,
translation.ko: 이 세상에서 유일하게 나를 행복하게 해줬던 사람이

translation.en: and she's only 85 miles away.
And I'm gonna go see her.
That felt awesome.
[Joel] Dear Aimee, I am done hiding.
I'm done waiting for things to get better.
It's time to take matters into my own hands.
Time to let someone else make the minestrone.
I'm taking a radio, even though it doesn't have power.
translation.ko: 무전기를 가져갈게 전기가 없어서 못 쓰지만

translation.en: But I'm gonna take it anyway.
-Wish me luck, Gertie. -[Gertie moos]
Mavis, take care of her.
You're not joking, are you?
Nope. Nope, I'm not.
He's not joking.
We're not letting you leave, Joel. You're needed here.
translation.ko: 안 내보내 줄 거야, 조엘 우리한테 필요한 존재니까

translation.en: Tim, no, I'm not. Come on. I don't do anything.
translation.ko: 팀, 아니잖아 나는 아무것도 안 해

translation.en: Joel, that's not true. You fix the radio. You make the minestrone.
translation.ko: 조엘, 아냐 너는 무전기를 고치고 미네스트로네를 만들어

translation.en: [exhales] Okay. Doesn't sound as important when I say it out loud.
translation.ko: 그래, 입 밖에 내보니까 중요한 일 같지는 않네

translation.en: I appreciate you trying. Really, I do.
I just don't feel like I belong anywhere.
translation.ko: 난 여기 어디에도 도움이 안 되는 것 같아

translation.en: I don't really wanna die all alone at the end of the world, so…
translation.ko: 세상이 끝나가는 마당에 외롭게 죽기는 싫어

translation.en: Look, I know you guys all just think of me as, like, some little, pathetic,
translation.ko: 다들 나를 딱하게 여기는 거 알아

translation.en: adorable hedgehog.
But I can take care of myself.
I'm actually probably a lot stronger than you might think.
-We made you a map. -Thanks, Karen.
Just… take care.
Everything will try to kill you.
Be observant. Use the advantages that you have.
-You're fast and small, so… -Right.
-Don't fight. -Don't fight.
Just run and hide.
Thanks, Ray.
You're an asshole if you get eaten.
-Okay. -Nice.
I love you guys. Tell Aimee I'll see her in seven days.
translation.ko: 사랑해 에이미한테 7일 후에 보러 간다고 전해줘

translation.en: -[Anderson] We believe in you. -[Tim] Love you, buddy.
Where am I?
Well, it's not super useful.
Okay, well, you know what? We know we gotta head west. Right?
So, let's just… do that.
Start with something easy. West.
Nope, it's this way. West is this way.
Shit.
Split the difference. Go this way.
Done. First decision made.
[Joel] Dear Aimee, I am doing it.
I'm really doing it!
Honestly, I thought it'd be way worse. So far, it's not too bad.
translation.ko: 솔직히 엄청 끔찍할 줄 알았는데 지금까지는 그리 나쁘지 않아

translation.en: I've seen a lot of signs of death, but no actual death.
translation.ko: 죽음의 흔적은 많이 봤지만 죽음을 목격하진 않았어

translation.en: So, cross your fingers.
Monster eggs.
Trying to stay positive.
Weather's nice. Getting some fresh air. What else can I tell ya?
translation.ko: 날씨도 좋고 공기도 맑아 또 무슨 말을 할까?

translation.en: Cool.
-Wham-O-- -[creatures chirping]
-[wings fluttering] -No.
-[branches snapping] -Run and hide.
Hide in the house. Hide in the house.
No.
No, no, no. No!
-[barking continues] -[grunts] No! No, no, no! [screaming]
-[growling] -Yes! Bite it! Bite it off!
Wait. Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait!
Where are you going?
Whoa, that was so cool.
Nice place.
-Can I sit? -[whines]
Thanks.
You all alone?
-[whines] -Yeah. Me too.
-Boy? -[grunts]
Is that your name? Boy? Your name is Boy.
I'm Joel.
Nice to meet ya.
Thanks, uh… Thanks for saving my life, Boy.
-[growls, whines] -Is this a dress?
Oh. Oh. Oh. Oh. Sorry.
Okay, I won't touch it again.
Was that your owner's?
It's okay. You don't have to talk about it.
Sorry.
Wait. Did you think I was her?
I'm gonna lie down too. Is that o--
No, it's okay. Just my backpack.
You know, I had a girl, too, once.
Think you would've really liked her. You guys would totally get along.
translation.ko: 너도 좋아했을 거야 둘이 완전 잘 맞았을걸?

translation.en: She loves dogs. I mean, all animals. She's a big animal lover.
translation.ko: 개를 비롯한 모든 동물을 사랑해 그야말로 동물 애호가지

translation.en: I haven't seen her in seven years.
Long time. That's why I'm trying to go find her.
I haven't told anyone this, but I'm kinda nervous about it.
translation.ko: 아무한테도 말 안 했는데 실은 좀 떨려

translation.en: Good night, Boy.
Weakness: dogs.
That's you.
You wouldn't happen to have a power source to a ham radio in here, would you?
'Cause I have a…
Never mind.
Huh. Lipstick.
Aimee.
Hey, would you mind if I kept this?
Thanks.
All right, well… this is it.
Thanks for having me.
I should… stop talking to a dog.
Okay. I'll see ya.
[sighs] Okay.
Oh, hey, hey, hey. No, no, no. None of that. Something might hear you.
translation.ko: 에이, 그러면 안 되지 누가 들을 수도 있어

translation.en: You wanna come with me?
Okay. You can come.
Let's go. Come on.
Uh-- What--
Yeah, we can bring that. You want me to put it in my bag?
translation.ko: 응, 가져가도 돼 내 가방에 넣어줄까?

translation.en: Okay. It's okay. I'm gonna keep it safe. I promise.
Going in the safe backpack.
See?
Okay, you ready?
Let's go. Come on.
Okay, that's really gonna have to stop.
Feels good, actually, having company.
[Joel] Dear Aimee, guess what.
I got a dog, and he's the coolest. His name is Boy.
translation.ko: 나한테 개가 생겼어 완전 멋지고 이름은 보이야

translation.en: He saved my life from a giant frog in a pool who tried to eat me with his tongue.
translation.ko: 연못에서 나온 거대한 개구리한테 잡아먹힐 뻔했는데 덕분에 살았어

translation.en: And then we hung out on his bus. Man, do we make a great team.
translation.ko: 보이가 사는 버스에도 가봤어 우리는 환상의 팀이야

translation.en: We found out we have a ton in common too. I feel like we can talk about anything.
translation.ko: 공통점이 참 많더라고 무슨 얘기든 할 수 있을 것 같아

translation.en: You gotta see us out here. We're like this iconic duo.
translation.ko: 네가 우리를 봐야 해 영화에 나오는 2인조 같아

translation.en: I don't know. Feels like when we're together, we're unstoppable.
translation.ko: 뭐, 나랑 보이가 똘똘 뭉치면 아무도 우리를 막을 수 없을걸

translation.en: Hey. What are you doing? What you got in there?
translation.ko: 보이, 왜 그래? 거기 뭐가 있어?

translation.en: -[clattering] -[Boy yips]
-Oh, my gosh. Yeah. Go. Go! -[creature chittering]
We gotta go! Come on!
Berries. [gasps]
Sustenance. Perfect.
-[growls] -Ow! What-- What are you doing?
But they look so good.
Yeah, you know what? I don't think I should eat these.
It's crazy the things you forget about the world. Like the smells.
translation.ko: 어떻게 이 멋진 것들을 잊었지? 자연의 냄새 말이야

translation.en: The grass, the trees, the flowers.
Sure, you get the occasional bloody corpse, but…
translation.ko: 물론 피범벅이 된 시체를 가끔 보기는 해도…

translation.en: [whispers] Oh, no. I fell in a hole.
-[whines] -Okay, I just gotta…
climb out.
I can climb out.
[whispers] Oh, no.
This is bad.
-Oh, this is so bad. -[barking]
[whispering] Stop. Stop it. Shh. Stop it.
It's a rope, you numbskull!
Put it around your foot and grab on!
Okay, come on! Hold on! [grunts]
Pull up! [screams]
-You wanna look at 'em? Oh, shit! -[groaning]
Minnow, finish 'em off.
One, two, three, four and--
Are we-- [groans, spits]
-[exhales] -Always count to five.
Was that a samurai sword?
Why'd you fall into a Sandgobbler's nest?
I didn't mean to, you know. I was just-- I was walking.
translation.ko: 일부러 빠진 게 아니야 나는 그냥 걷고 있었어

translation.en: -What's your name? -Joel.
Joel Dawson.
I'm, uh, Clyde. This is Minnow.
You're lucky we weren't monsters. You were yelling like a girl.
translation.ko: 우리가 괴물이면 어쩔 뻔했어요? 뭔 여자애처럼 소리 지르던데

translation.en: [high-pitched voice] "This is bad! This is so bad!"
Okay, I don't sound like that. My voice is not that high-pitched.
translation.ko: 그렇게 말하지는 않았거든? 내 목소리 그렇게 안 높잖아

translation.en: -Yeah, it is. -Yes, it is.
It was higher than mine, and I'm eight.
What in God's name are you doing up here alone anyway?
-I'm not alone. I've got Boy too. -[whines]
Oh, wait, no! No, wait, wait!
-[Joel groans] -Oh, my God, it's a puppy!
[Minnow] Come here, Boy! Come here, Boy!
-They almost killed my dog. -Hi, Boy!
translation.ko: - 내 개를 죽일 뻔했네 - 안녕, 보이!

translation.en: -Hi! [giggles] -[Clyde chuckles]
Hey.
So, uh, what happened with your colony, man?
They kick you out?
No, I actually left on my own.
-Something I had to do. -You stole food, didn't you?
-He's a food stealer. -Yeah.
No, I didn't steal any food.
Right.
Me and my colony were really close. Like family. Okay?
They were super upset that I left.
-Time to go, Minnow. -[Joel] Time to go? Why? -So, what-- -[growling continues]
What, uh-- What was that? What's going on?
-Could've been a lot of things. -[Minnow] Tree Flamer. Herd Stomper.
translation.ko: - 그야 알 수 없지 - 트리 플레이머, 허드 스톰퍼

translation.en: [scoffs] Rockdiver.
Limbsnapper. Limbcrusher. And my favorite-- the Chumbler.
translation.ko: 림 스내퍼, 림 크러셔 내가 제일 좋아하는 첨블러

translation.en: [Joel] Okay, I get it. A lot of-- A lot of names.
[Clyde] Whatever it is, it took your screams for the dinner bell.
translation.ko: 뭐든 간에, 네가 내지른 비명을 저녁 식사 종소리로 들은 거지

translation.en: If it's got your scent, it's gonna be on you for a while.
translation.ko: 체취까지 맡았다면 한동안 너를 찾아다닐 거야

translation.en: Hey, maybe I could, like, I don't know, come with you guys.
[Clyde] Which way you headed?
Going west.
To the coast. Jenner Beach.
Yeah. We're not cutting north just yet.
translation.ko: 그러든가 당장 북쪽으로 꺾진 않을 거야

translation.en: -Not cu-- Not cutting north just yet. -Come on. Come on.
Yeah. Whatever you want.
You guys want me to come, I'll come.
Come on.
That's a good, uh… little workout.
[Clyde] A girl, huh?
Yeah. [groans]
You left a nice, safe colony to travel all the way to the ocean
translation.ko: 안전한 집단을 떠나서 바다로 가는 이유가

translation.en: for a girl you ain't seen since you were, what, 17?
translation.ko: 17살 이후로 못 본 여자를 다시 만나기 위해서라고?

translation.en: No, I know what you're thinking. I know how it sounds. It's crazy.
translation.ko: 어떻게 생각하는지 알아요 정신 나간 소리로 들리겠죠

translation.en: But… I don't know.
If you knew our connection, you'd probably feel differently.
translation.ko: 우리가 어떤 사이였는지 알면 다르게 와닿을 거예요

translation.en: We actually just got back in touch over the radio a few weeks ago.
translation.ko: 몇 주 전에 무전으로 연락이 닿았어요

translation.en: And it's still there. It's just magical. And so sweet.
translation.ko: 여전하더라고요, 마법 같죠 참 대단한 사랑이에요

translation.en: She loves me too, so a "pick up right here we left off" kind of thing.
translation.ko: 에이미도 절 사랑하니까 다시 잘해보려는 거예요

translation.en: -It's still there. -You ever hear the term "fool's errand"?
All right, what, so I'm a fool because I believe in true love?
No, you're a fool because you're out here alone,
you don't know a thing about survival…
[Joel] Wind.
…you shoot for shit,
yet you got an attitude like you're some kind of noble warrior
floating on the wings of love.
-Doesn't work like that. -Okay.
Super encouraging speech.
-Damn it. -You're braining out.
-Huh? -Braining out. Thinking too much.
I always clear my mind and say to myself,
translation.ko: 난 항상 머리를 비우고 이 생각만 해요

translation.en: "a needle through water."
"A needle through water"?
Trust me. My dad was the best archer in my colony.
translation.ko: 믿어봐요, 우리 아빠가 집단 최고의 궁수였어요

translation.en: Oh, really? Okay. Then how come he's not the one giving me the lessons?
translation.ko: 그러셔? 그런데 왜 아빠는 가만있고 네가 나를 가르치고 있어?

translation.en: 'Cause I'm not her dad.
Yeah, my dad got killed.
Back when we lived in the subway station.
Along with Elliot.
Uh, wh-who's Elliot?
My son.
-Oh, I'm sorry. -No need to be sorry.
We all have stories like that. Don't we?
Needle through water.
[mutters] Needle through water.
Hey, that was pretty close.
-It was better. -It was really good, right?
Right?
[Clyde] Tell you what, kid. You gonna hang with us, you need to know stuff.
translation.ko: 잘 들어, 우리랑 함께하려면 너도 살아남을 줄 알아야 해

translation.en: Yeah. Okay.
-First lesson. -Yeah. Hit me.
Always survey from high ground when possible.
-Always. -[Joel] Always.
Helps you spot the big ones in advance.
Nice to know that thing's not following us anymore.
No, no, it's definitely still following us. Just saw it.
translation.ko: 무슨 소리? 아직 따라오고 있어 내가 방금 봤어

translation.en: -What-- -Yeah.
-Chumbler. -I knew it.
-Big son of a bitch too. -Big sumanabitch.
translation.ko: - 아주 커다란 망할 자식이지 - 더럽게 큰 망할 놈

translation.en: -[groans] -[Clyde] Got your scent too, man.
-It's gonna be hard to shake. -Then why are we still standing here?
translation.ko: - 따돌리기 힘들겠어 - 그런데 왜 이러고 있어요?

translation.en: Relax. Chumblers aren't fast.
-We gotta keep moving. -Mmm.
Should've already been gone.
-It's got my scent. -[Clyde] Oh, yeah, it does.
-[Clyde] Comin'? -Yeah!
-Where you guys headed anyway? -[Clyde] North.
-To the mountains. -What's up there?
A, uh, place called Snow Mountain Wilderness.
Supposed to be some kind of colony up there full of survivors.
translation.ko: 집단 같은 게 있을 텐데 생존자가 많을 거야

translation.en: The cold and elevation help to keep the monsters away.
translation.ko: 추위와 고도 때문에 괴물들이 가까이 못 오거든

translation.en: You should definitely come with us.
Well, I would, but, you know--
You gotta go find your girlfriend.
-Yeah, yeah. -[Joel] Uh…
Minnow.
If you knew her, you'd really like her. She's a super cool person.
translation.ko: 너도 에이미를 알면 좋아할걸? 엄청나게 멋진 사람이야

translation.en: Well, she's not gonna like you,
'cause you can't even get out of a Sandgobbler's nest.
And honestly, I just like you 'cause you have a really cute dog.
translation.ko: 솔직히 귀여운 강아지를 봐서 조엘을 받아준 거예요

translation.en: -Hurts my feelings. -You're so useless.
It just means she likes you, man.
She's, uh-- She's been through a lot.
Yeah.
So annoying.
-Joel. -What?
Don't move.
-Oh, my God. Why? -Give me your shirt.
-[rumbling] -My shirt? What do you mean?
[Clyde] Your shirt, man. Give me your shirt.
-Okay. -Get-- Hurr-- Come on.
-Do what he says, Joel. -Give me your shirt.
translation.ko: - 시키는 대로 해요, 조엘 - 셔츠 이리 줘

translation.en: -[rumbling continues] -Shut up. I'm trying.
Easy. Take it easy.
-That's it. That's it. -Is it a Chumbler?
-No. -[whimpers] What is it called?
Take it easy. Lean over, man.
-If I don't make it-- -Shh, shh.
-That's it. That's it. -[gasping, whimpering]
Just stay very still.
-[trembling whisper] Okay. -Shh.
[Clyde] Okay, buddy.
Shh, shh, shh, shh. Easy does it.
-[growling continues] -It's okay.
You're okay.
It's okay. You're all right.
All right. Okay, now.
-On your way. -[roars]
Okay, now.
-All good. On your way now. -[roaring continues]
On your way.
Good boy. Good boy.
What you so scared for? Boulder Snails are nice.
translation.ko: 왜 그렇게 쫄았어요? 볼더 스네일은 착해요

translation.en: There can be nice ones?
You can always tell in their eyes. Just look at their eyes.
translation.ko: 눈을 보면 알 수 있죠 눈을 봐요

translation.en: -This one probably saved our lives too. -[whispers] Saved our--
translation.ko: - 녀석이 우리 목숨을 구한 셈이야 - 목숨을요?

translation.en: Gonna spread your scent all over this hillside.
translation.ko: 네 체취를 온 산에 퍼뜨릴 테니까

translation.en: Shoot. That old Chumbler ain't gonna know which way to go.
translation.ko: 됐어, 늙은 첨블러 놈이 갈 길을 잃고 헤맬 거야

translation.en: [Joel] So the Chumbler's gonna follow my shirt?
-[Boulder Snail roars] -Thank you, Mr. Boulder Snail.
-Thank you, Mr. Boulder Snail! -[slurred] Thank you.
[Clyde] Yeah, they're very sensitive, you know.
But they'll crush your ass…
in a second.
[Clyde] What you working on, man?
Just a little project I started a while back in my colony.
translation.ko: 집단에 있을 때 혼자서 소소한 프로젝트를 시작했어요

translation.en: Every time we encountered a new monster, I'd just make a little entry.
translation.ko: 새로운 괴물을 만날 때마다 기록을 남겼죠

translation.en: A drawing. Um, just some info about it.
You know, strengths, weaknesses. Stuff like that.
Made me feel like I was helping out, you know.
-[Clyde] You're a pretty good artist. -[Joel] Thanks.
-I seen this one. Ugly bastard. -Yeah.
-Doesn't like loud noises. -Oh, yeah.
Also doesn't like shotgun blasts to the head.
Might wanna add that.
Shotgun to the face.
-Yeah. Got it. -[Clyde] Oh.
-Do you mind if I… -Oh, sure.
Yeah. Oh, thanks. Thanks.
-Oh, wow. -[Joel] Yeah.
I was 16 when it hit.
Yeah, they sent everything up at once to take her down.
translation.ko: 애거사를 격추하겠다고 로켓을 있는 대로 쏴댔지

translation.en: They had the balls to call us the lucky ones
just 'cause whatever the hell was in those things didn't affect us.
translation.ko: 로켓에 뭐가 들었든 간에 인간을 괴물로 만들진 않았다고

translation.en: Ain't nothing lucky about getting kicked off the top of the food chain.
translation.ko: 먹이 사슬의 최상층에서 밀려난 건 절대 다행으로 여길 수 없지

translation.en: Yeah, my parents thought if we could… just make it out of Fairfield,
we might have a shot.
Wait, wait, wait.
You're from Fairfield?
Yeah. Why?
Man, I've never met anyone who made it out of Fairfield.
translation.ko: 페어필드에서 살아 나온 사람은 처음 봐

translation.en: That place was basically ground zero.
Shit, I've only heard horror stories.
Yeah, it was pretty bad.
Your parents, uh…
Oh, uh, no.
[clears throat] No, it's just me.
Couldn't save 'em.
You putting that on yourself?
[sighs] You're from Fairfield, man. You shouldn't even be here. Right?
translation.ko: 너는 페어필드에서 온 녀석이야 살아있는 게 기적이지, 안 그래?

translation.en: You're more of a survivor than I thought.
That's the coolest thing anyone's ever said to me.
It's a good start.
Keep it up. Book like this could save someone's life out here.
translation.ko: 계속해, 이런 내용의 책이면 사람 목숨을 구할 수도 있어

translation.en: Thanks, Clyde.
[Clyde] You, um…
sure your girl's worth it?
Coming all this way?
Yeah.
Yeah, she is.
[Minnow] Don't settle, Joel.
[Clyde] She's right.
You don't have to.
Not even at the end of the world.
-[Boy whines] -[Clyde] Okay!
-Time to break camp! Let's go! -[Joel] Uh, wh--
Lesson two.
You get a hot meal or a good night's sleep.
-Not both. -Not both.
Are you being serious?
Something will have smelled our food and be all over this camp within the hour.
translation.ko: 웬 놈이 음식 냄새를 맡고 1시간 안에 이곳을 덮칠 거야

translation.en: Why wouldn't you tell me that, though? Uh, I didn't-- I didn't do either.
translation.ko: 왜 미리 말을 안 했어요? 저는 아무것도 못 했어요

translation.en: I can't tell you everything, man. Keep up.
translation.ko: 어떻게 일일이 다 말해줘? 빨리 배워

translation.en: "Roar! I'm gonna kill you, Joel Dawson! I'm gonna eat you like broccoli!"
translation.ko: '너를 죽일 거야, 조엘 도슨! 브로콜리처럼 씹어 먹겠어!'

translation.en: "I'm Joel, and I can't protect my girlfriend
because I'm useless and insecure and an awkward little teenager."
translation.ko: '난 쓸모없고 자신감도 없고 어쭙잖은 십 대일 뿐이니까'

translation.en: "But I need you to save me! I thought you loved me."
"But I can't because--" [sputtering, shrieking]
-What? -That's your girlfriend dying.
-What? -A needle through water.
A needle through water. Needle through water.
Whoo-hoo-hoo-hoo! Yes! See? Bull's-eye!
Got yourself an admirer there, huh?
Hey, we gotta get going.
Uh, okay. Come on. Come on. We gotta go. We--
Minnow? What are you doing?
[Joel] Dear Aimee, I made friends.
Human friends.
And they're teaching me everything they know.
translation.ko: 나한테 모든 걸 가르쳐 주고 있어

translation.en: Like lesson three: Don't take shortcuts.
translation.ko: 세 번째 교훈은 지름길로 가지 말 것

translation.en: Lesson eight: Target practice every day.
translation.ko: 여덟 번째 교훈은 매일 사격 연습을 할 것

translation.en: Getting pretty good with my crossbow.
-[Minnow laughs] See? -[Clyde] Pretty good.
Lesson ten: Keep your socks dry. That's a great one.
translation.ko: 열 번째 교훈은 양말을 말릴 것 훌륭한 가르침이야

translation.en: I'm kinda struggling with lesson two: Not both. That one is not great.
translation.ko: 두 번째 교훈은 따르기가 어려워 둘 중 하나만 할 것 영 맘에 안 들어

translation.en: [Clyde] Not both. Not both.
-[clap] -Come on, Joel. Not both.
I'm super tired.
All right, a lot of things out here you shouldn't touch or eat,
translation.ko: 자, 야생 식물 대부분은 만지거나 먹어선 안 돼

translation.en: but, uh, ferns like these have an antivenom.
translation.ko: 하지만 이런 양치식물에는 해독 성분이 있지

translation.en: Good in a pinch for snakes, slugs.
-Great entry for your book. -[Joel] Yep, got it.
translation.ko: - 네 책에 써두면 좋을 거야 - 알겠습니다

translation.en: The insect-looking ones got no peripheral vision.

translation.en: No peripheral-- Ah!
The lizard-looking ones can't climb for shit.
translation.ko: 도마뱀처럼 생긴 놈들은 기어오르는 재주가 없어

Badasses!
Yeah, I know. I fell into their hole.
What you saw were worker bees.
What you wanna avoid under all circumstances is a queen.
How do I know if it's a queen?
Well, your first clue would be a giant fin slicing through the earth,
translation.ko: 첫 번째 단서는 땅을 가르는 커다란 지느러미야

translation.en: following every single sound and vibration you make.

translation.en: -You howling in pain… -[shrieks]
…as you're being ripped in half will be your second.
translation.ko: 몸이 반으로 찢어지면 그게 두 번째 단서야

translation.en: -[groans] -Copy. I'll keep that in mind.
[Clyde] Well, we're getting close to where our paths diverge.
translation.ko: 조금 더 가면 우리가 헤어져야 하는 지점이야

translation.en: You're gonna wanna go west to Jenner, the beaches.

translation.en: Or you can be sensible, come with us to the mountains.

translation.en: Yeah, um, I think I've been sensible all my life,
translation.ko: 그렇죠 평생 합리적으로 살았는데 아무 소용 없더라고요

translation.en: it's really gotten me nowhere.
translation.ko: 평생 합리적으로 살았는데 아무 소용 없더라고요

translation.en: Come with us. Strength in numbers, you know?
Besides, think we'd make a good team.
No, I think so, too. I just, uh--
It's just something I gotta do. It's not fair.
translation.ko: - 저는 가야만 해요 - 그런 게 어디 있어!

translation.en: Wh-- Hey. Wha--
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Whoa, whoa. What's going on?
[crying] Why do you gotta go?
'Cause this girl, she means a lot to me. You know?
Come on. You know I gotta do this. We talked about this.
translation.ko: 내가 가야만 하는 거 알잖아 지난번에 얘기했지?

translation.en: Hey, you know what? I got something for ya.
I don't even know if you'd know what this is, but--
Lipstick?
-[laughs] What? -Yeah.
-[giggles] -Yeah, it's lip--
I take back what I said before.
Aimee's gonna love you.
Thanks, Minnow. You got some snot.
-[laughs] Yeah. -[Joel chuckles]
All right. Come on.
[Clyde] Final lesson.
Listen to your instincts out here. They'll keep you alive.
translation.ko: 네 본능에 귀를 기울여 목숨을 지켜줄 테니까

translation.en: Yeah. What if I have, uh, terrible instincts?
You'll die.
Listen, man, good instincts are earned by making mistakes.
translation.ko: 명심해, 탁월한 본능은 실수를 통해서 키우는 법이야

translation.en: If you're lucky enough to survive a few mistakes,
translation.ko: 몇 번의 실수를 하고도 생존할 만큼 운이 좋으면

translation.en: you're gonna be okay out here.
This might come in handy, too.
Wow!
Oh, that's great. Do you have, uh-- Do you have any more that I could have?
translation.ko: 좋네요, 혹시 더 줄 수 있어요?

translation.en: You get one.
Pull the pin, count to five. Not four, not six.
translation.ko: 핀을 뽑고 딱 다섯까지 세 넷도 아니고 여섯도 아냐

translation.en: Five.
-Got it. -[sniffs]
You're gonna be okay.
Minnow?
Let's go, kid.
Hey, man, you made it all this way from Fairfield.
What's another 30 miles, huh?
[Clyde] Uh-oh, here he comes.
-Hi. -[Clyde chuckles]
Hey there.
I know. I'm gonna miss 'em, too.
It's a good decision, though. It's good.
You feel good about it, right?
Come on, Boy.
Aw, I'm okay. I'm just gonna--
You can have that.
I'll just stick to the beans.
-I'm good. -[whines]
I'm not gonna eat that, so…
Hey, come on. We gotta keep moving.
I know. There's a lot of creepy stuff. Creepy boats.
Kind of a creepy sign.
But nothing we haven't seen before. Just gotta be brave.
-[Boy whines] -What…
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. What's going on? What's happening?
-You okay? -[barks]
-You hearing something? Boy? -[barks]
Boy, Boy, Boy! Boy!
Hey! Boy! Boy! Boy!
-Boy! Are you okay? -[whines]
I need some kind of communication here.
Oh. I hear it.
We gotta go. Hey.
We really gotta go. Please get out from under the duck.

translation.en: [whispers] We gotta go.
[woman] Joel. You okay?
You okay?
Joel! Get out of the car!
Joel, get outta the car!
Run, Joel, run!
Run! Go!
[mother] You can survive this.
I love you.
[echoing] I love you.
No.
Hey!
-[whining] -Boy?
Are you okay?
Yeah! Yeah, you're okay! You're okay!
You're okay. You're okay. You're okay.
Aren't you? Aren't you?
Yeah!
We're monster killers.
Wow.
You know, I haven't felt the rain in seven years.
Pretty cool. Pretty cool.
Hey, Boy, you think I'm crazy?
Coming all this way?
[female electronic voice] Hello.
Holy shit.
You're alive.
I mean… you're on.
I have 51 minutes of power left. What is your name?
translation.ko: 앞으로 51분 후에 종료될 겁니다 이름이 뭔가요?

translation.en: Uh, I'm Joel.
-My name is Joel. -Hello, Joel.
I am so pleased to meet you.
My name is Mavis.
But if you were to write it out,
you would write it with a 1 and not an I.
translation.ko: 알파벳 I 대신에 숫자 1을 써야 해요

translation.en: Yeah, I know.
You are familiar with the Mav1s line. Delightful!
You guys were supposed to be the next amazing thing.
I can't believe I'm talkin' to one.
But if you were to write it out,
you would write it with a 1 and not an I.
translation.ko: 알파벳 I 대신에 숫자 1을 써야 해요

translation.en: Yeah. You said that.
Years ago, I was bitten in half
by something I did not get a chance to name.
translation.ko: 어떤 것에게 공격당했는데 이름을 붙이지도 못했네요

translation.en: I crawled here for safety and powered down,
translation.ko: 여기까지 겨우 기어 와서는 스스로 전원을 차단했어요

translation.en: hoping someone would one day find me.
translation.ko: 언젠가는 누군가 나타나서 저를 발견하길 바라면서요

translation.en: -And here you are! -[chuckles softly]
Amazing.
Joel, besides conversing with me, for which I am eternally grateful,
translation.ko: 조엘, 나와 이렇게 대화해 준 것 영원히 잊지 않고 고마워할게요

translation.en: may I ask what you are doing outside of your colony?
translation.ko: 그런데 집단에서 나와서 뭘 하고 있는지 물어봐도 될까요?

translation.en: Yeah, um--
Did you steal food?
No.
No, I didn't steal any food.
Um, I'm actually on a quest… to find a girl.
Why, Joel, a lovely lady has caught your eye!
What is her name?
Uh, her name's Aimee. With one I and two E's.
She sounds like an incredible person, Joel.
translation.ko: 정말 멋진 사람인 것 같네요, 조엘

translation.en: Is there anything I can do to assist you
translation.ko: 제가 도울 수 있는 일이 있을까요?

translation.en: in your quest for Aimee with one I and two E's?
translation.ko: I 하나와 E 둘의 에이미를 찾는 일을 돕고 싶어요

translation.en: Nope. Appreciate it, Mav1s, but, uh, unfortunately not.
Unless you happen to have a power source to an SK-21 ham radio handy.
translation.ko: SK-21 햄 무전기를 켤 전력이 있다면 모를까

translation.en: Oh, no, but--
I would be honored to donate my remaining power to you
translation.ko: 제게 남은 전력을 조엘에게 줄 수 있다면 영광이죠

translation.en: if it would help you with your quest for Aimee with one I and two E's.
translation.ko: I 하나와 E 둘의 에이미를 찾는 일을 돕는 거라면요

translation.en: She probably thinks I've been devoured by now.
Oh, this is all so exciting!
-It's working. -Hooray!
-[Aimee] Joel? -Aimee! Hey. Hey.
Your colony told me you were coming here. Are you okay?
I was worried. It's so good to hear your voice.
translation.ko: 걱정했는데 네 목소리 들으니까 맘이 놓인다

translation.en: Yeah, it's good to hear yours, too. Yeah, I'm alive. I'm good. I'm okay.
translation.ko: 나도 네 목소리 들어서 좋아 나 멀쩡하게 살아있어

translation.en: I-I-I can't believe you're actually doing this.
translation.ko: 네가 진짜 오고 있다니 안 믿겨

translation.en: I feel like a whole new man, you know?

translation.ko: 내가 어쩌고 있는지 봐야 해 괴물들과 맞서 싸우고 있어

translation.en: I'm in a motel right now with a robot and a dog.
What? That sounds crazy.
translation.ko: 지금은 모텔에 로봇하고 개랑 있어 뭐? 말도 안 돼

I'm 9.3 miles to you.
Joel, listen. I have amazing news.
Some survivors showed up a few days ago, and they're rescuing us.
translation.ko: 며칠 전에 생존자들이 왔는데 우리를 구조해 주고 있어

Oh. Okay, g-getting you out of there? What do you mean?
I can't remember the last time I actually felt like everything was going to be--
translation.ko: 다 잘될 거라고 생각했던 게 언제가 마지막인지 모르겠…

translation.en: Wh-- Aimee? Aimee? Aimee?
Shit.
My battery has automatically shut down

translation.ko: 마지막 15분을 버티기 위한 전력을 유지해야 해서요

translation.en: -I am very sorry, Joel. -No, it's okay, Mav1s.
translation.ko: 정말 미안해요, 조엘 괜찮아, 그럴 것 없어

translation.en: -You don't have to… -[thunder rumbling]
Joel?
I haven't been outside in a very long time.
Yeah. I hadn't, either.
-There you go. -Is something troubling you, Joel?
You can tell me anything, as I am an empathetic listener.
translation.ko: 저에게는 뭐든지 말해도 돼요 전 공감 능력이 뛰어나답니다

translation.en: Also, my memory banks will be permanently erased in 14 minutes.
translation.ko: 게다가 제 기억 장치에 저장되어도 14분 후 영구적으로 삭제될 거고요

translation.en: You know that feeling where you just completely put yourself out there?
translation.ko: 진짜 큰마음 먹고 도전에 나서는 기분 알아?

translation.en: You know? And you're so sure of it.
And… right when you're about to cross the finish line,

translation.en: you just think is this the dumbest… thing I ever could've done?
translation.ko: 결승선을 통과하려는 순간에 이런 생각이 드는 거야 이보다 더 멍청한 짓이 있을까?

translation.en: I don't think it's dumb, Joel.
I think it's romantic.
Right, see? Yeah, okay, you get it.
Romantic, that's what-- Yeah.
Do not give up on your quest, Joel.
When you see her, she will appreciate the grand romantic gesture
translation.ko: 여정 끝에 에이미를 만나면 아주 로맨틱한 행동이란 걸 알아줄 거예요

translation.en: implied by your journey
translation.ko: 아주 로맨틱한 행동이란 걸 알아줄 거예요

translation.en: and be moved by your kindness and leadership qualities.

translation.en: Thanks, Mav1s.
Another option is that Aimee will not see those qualities in you

translation.en: and you will have traveled a great distance

Perhaps you will have learned valuable lessons along the way?
translation.ko: 그렇대도 그 과정에서 귀한 교훈을 얻겠죠?

translation.en: Okay.
A third option is that you don't survive the journey at all

translation.en: and get eaten by mutated insects…
-Okay, that's-- I get it. -…amphibians--
There are so many ways you could perish.
I get it.
Thanks for the…
Thanks for that.
Would you like to see a trick, Joel?
Sure.
What is your full name, and where were you born?
Uh, Joel Dawson. Fairfield, California.
What lovely parents you had, Joel.
[Joel] Oh, my God.
Wow.
I don't even have a picture.
What would you say to your mother now, Joel,
if you had the chance?
I guess I'd tell her I'm okay.
I made it to a colony.
Met a lot of really, really good people
who took really good care of me.
They also lost a lot, so…
[crying] And I miss you guys so much.
I'm so sorry.
Oh, look! Sky Jellies!
They're harmless and quite lovely.
Wow.
Oh! Canis familiaris!
You found my foot. Thank you.
-That's my dog. -He's delightful.
[Joel] Yeah, he's a good boy.
-Joel, would you like to hear a song? -[humming, chirping continue]
[Joel] Yeah, okay.
You know, nature's kinda nice when there's nothing trying to kill you.
translation.ko: 날 죽이려는 것만 없으면 자연은 참 근사해

translation.en: Mav1s?
Thanks.
[Joel] Some survivors showed up at the camp.
That's not something I gotta worry about, you don't think, right?
I mean, what are the odds that they're, like, awesome
translation.ko: 그 생존자들이 훈남일 확률이 얼마나 되겠어?

translation.en: and similar to my age and potentially a threat to me romantically?
translation.ko: 마침 나랑 나이도 비슷해서 내 로맨스에 위협이 된다?

translation.en: Slim to none, probably.
I think it's good, actually. I think we're totally, uh… fine.

translation.en: Actually, why don't we pick up the pace a little bit, just in case--
translation.ko: 그래도 혹시 모르니까 속도를 좀 올려볼…

translation.en: Okay, you know what?
Why don't we go another way. Yeah?
Boy? Boy!
Boy, where you going?
Queen.
Run, Boy! Run!
-[Boy yips] -Get--
-Go, go! Go! -[yipping continues]
[shouts] Wait!
Boy!
Boy, I can't run that fast! [gasping]
Oh, my God. Oh, I'm so sorry.
I'm sorry.
[whispers] What are you doing?
Don't you dare.
-Whoa, whoa. What are you doing? -[yips]
No. Wait, Boy!
Boy!
-[whimpers] -Boy, don't even think about it.
Don't. Don't you do it.
-Don't. Don't. No! -[barks]
Count to five.
One, two--
Shit!
Two. Uh, three, four…
five!
Yes!
Yes! Oh, my God!
Oh, that was awesome.
I feel like Tom Cruise. [gasps]
[grunts] Oh! Ow. What the hell is--
Oh, my God.
Get that dress out of my face!
Boy?
Okay.
Oh, no.
Okay, all right, I think I'm good.
I think I got 'em all.
What?
God! No! [grunting]
[shouting] You! You! You!
This is all your fault! What is wrong with you?
Why don't you listen to me, huh? Huh?
You have any idea what you just did? You almost got us killed!
translation.ko: 네가 무슨 짓을 했는지 알아? 우리 죽을 뻔했어!

translation.en: We are supposed to care about each other, okay?
I would never do that to you, never! You bailed on me! Oh, my God!
translation.ko: 나는 너한테 절대 안 그래! 어떻게 날 두고 혼자 튀냐? 환장하겠네, 그 망할 놈의 드레스!

translation.en: That freakin' dress! I can't take it anymore!
translation.ko: 환장하겠네, 그 망할 놈의 드레스! 더는 못 참아!

translation.en: [Joel] Dear Aimee, it's not looking good.
translation.ko: 에이미에게, 이건 좀 아닌 것 같아

translation.en: And by "it," I don't remember what I was talking about.
translation.ko: 뭘 두고 하는 말이냐고? 나도 그게 기억이 안 나

translation.en: I can't feel my feet.
Or my face.
I think I'm dying.
[Minnow] I'm gonna kill you, Joel Dawson! I'm gonna eat you like broccoli!
translation.ko: 너를 죽일 거야, 조엘 도슨! 브로콜리처럼 씹어 먹겠어!

translation.en: [Clyde] Ferns like these have an antivenom.
-Good in a pinch for snakes, slugs. -[gasping]
[Joel] If you find the best dog ever,
that's Boy.
Please, look after him.
Tell him I'm sorry.
-[whispering] Have you seen my dog? -Tell him I love him.
Have you seen him? I yelled at him.
translation.ko: 보이를 봤어요? 내가 막 소리를 질렀어요

translation.en: Don't take his dress out of his mouth. He doesn't like that.
And now I might not ever see him again.
And please don't shout at him. I know you won't.
translation.ko: 보이한테 소리 지르지 마세요 안 그러시겠지만요

translation.en: Joel.
Oh, my God.
-It's you. -Aimee?
I can't believe you made it.
Oh, my God. I can't believe you made it.
You made it, Joel.
-Are you okay? -Yeah, yeah.
Oh, you're so beautiful.
That was nice.
Aimee?
Aimee.
-Aimee. -Hey, hey, hey, hey. T-T-Take it easy. Take it easy.
Still pretty messed up from all the poison. How do you feel?
translation.ko: 독 때문에 몸이 말이 아냐, 어때?

translation.en: I feel-- I'm good.
Good. No, I'm f-- I-I'm okay.
What was it like? I mean, you have to tell me everything.
translation.ko: 오는 길은 어땠어? 다 말해줘야 해

translation.en: Honestly, it wasn't that bad. I don't know what everyone's complaining about.
translation.ko: 솔직히 할 만했어 다들 뭐가 그리 불만인가 싶어

translation.en: -Oh? -No, it was terrible.
I almost… died a lot.
It's so good to see you.
I'm lucky you found me when you did.
About that, um…
And hey, we… kissed.
-You were hallucinating pretty hard. -How amazing was that, huh?
translation.ko: - 환각 증상이 엄청 심했어 - 좋았잖아? 너 피트랑 키스했어

translation.en: You kissed Old Pete.
-Hi, Pete. -Oh. Yeah.
That'd be hilarious.
Oh, yeah, I really did.
I don't know how to move on from this.
What was that you said on the radio about, uh--
Yeah. This yacht captain and his crew show up out of the blue.
translation.ko: 요트 선장이랑 선원들이 어느 날 뜬금없이 나타났어

translation.en: -Did you say a yacht captain? -Yeah, yeah.
And he says he can find us a safe place to live and a new home.
translation.ko: 우리가 지낼 안전한 장소와 새 은신처를 찾아줄 수 있대

translation.en: I'm trying to pack everything up right now.
Why is he called a yacht captain?
'Cause he's the captain of the yacht, you moron.
Oh, my God. Be nice, Bill.
translation.ko: 내가 못 살아 친절하게 대해줘요, 빌!

translation.en: -What? -I'm trying to listen.
So anyway, I just wanted to say something to you, though--
Aimee! Aimee! We got another leak in the main line.
translation.ko: 에이미! 주 배관에 또 새는 곳이 있어

translation.en: Bastard's spitting freshwater all over the beach!
translation.ko: 이 빌어먹을 배관이 온 해변에 식수를 뿌리고 있다고

translation.en: Yeah, yeah, thank you, Janice. I'll be right there.
-Oh. -Hi, Joel.
Hey, Janice. Good to meet you.
-Please-- -Everyone's so old.
-[laughs] You came at a crazy time. -Yeah.
-Can we put a pin in this? -Yeah.
[whispers] Put a pin in it. Sure.
Hey, man.

-Oh, my God! -Hey, hey, hey!
I'm alive because of the generosity of a few strangers
translation.ko: 제가 이렇게 살아있는 건 두 낯선 사람의 관대함과

translation.en: and the kindness of a great dog.
My colony and I are headed to the mountains.
There's supposed to be less monsters there.
And don't get me wrong. The surface is a dangerous place.
translation.ko: 제 뜻을 오해하지는 마세요 지상은 아주 위험천만해요

translation.en: But I don't think hiding underground is the answer anymore.
translation.ko: 하지만 지하에 숨어 사는 게 해답은 아닌 것 같아요

translation.en: There is a great big, beautiful, inspiring world out there.
translation.ko: 저 바깥에는 광활하고 아름답고 용기를 주는 세상이 있어요

translation.en: [on radio] And I know you think it might be impossible, but it's not.
If I can survive out here, anybody can.
translation.ko: 제가 살아남을 수 있다면 누구나 할 수 있어요

translation.en: It's like a good friend once told me.
Good instincts are earned by making mistakes.
translation.ko: 탁월한 본능은 실수를 통해서 키우는 법이다

translation.en: If you're lucky enough to survive a few mistakes,
translation.ko: 몇 번의 실수를 하고도 생존할 만큼 운이 좋으면

translation.en: you're gonna do all right out here.
In this recording, you'll find everything I know about our new world.
translation.ko: 새로운 세상에 대해서 제가 아는 모든 걸 녹음했어요

translation.en: Most of this I had to learn the hard way.
Hopefully, it'll make your way a little easier.
So, crank open that hatch.
Okay, come on.
[Joel] Breathe some fresh air. Go. Live your life.
translation.ko: 상쾌한 공기를 마셔요 당신의 삶을 살아요

translation.en: It won't be easy, but it'll be worth it.
translation.ko: 결코 쉽지 않겠지만 그만한 가치가 있을 거예요

translation.en: I traveled 85 miles to find that what I'd been missing below ground for seven years
was right above my head this whole time.
translation.ko: 제 머리 바로 위에 그대로 있었다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: And it's incredible.
Oh, and one last thing. Don't settle.
You don't have to. Not even at the end of the world.
translation.ko: 그럴 필요 없어요 세상이 끝났다고 해도요

translation.en: Signing off,
Joel Dawson.
[Minnow] "Don't settle"? That's my line.
It's a long journey, kid. I hope you know what you're doing.
translation.ko: 아주 긴 여정이 될 거다 녀석이 부디 알고 있기를

translation.en: [Minnow] He definitely doesn't. Snow Spiders will probably get him.
translation.ko: 조엘이 알 리가 없죠 스노 스파이더한테 당할걸요

translation.en: -[Clyde] That's not a good way to go. -[Minnow] They will tear him apart.
translation.ko: - 그 꼴은 안 나야 할 텐데 - 온몸이 갈기갈기 찢어질 거예요

translation.en: -[Clyde] Nah, he'll figure it out. -[Minnow] Possibly.
translation.ko: - 에이, 살길을 찾겠지 - 그럴 수도 있고요
